description: If you love Vietnamese food of any kind, you have to try Anh Hong aka "7 Courses of Beef".  The vinegar fondue is absolutely amazing, and the idea of make-your-own spring roll is totally fulfulling and tasty.
author: Dave K.

description:
Finally a place serving Bo Bai Mon (Seven course beef) in San Francisco. I have been languishing for a chance to enjoy this beef extravagance for years, and although it was not everything I had hoped for, it was good, tasty and entertaining succession of different beef dishes.
I see this seven beef dishes as Vietnamese cuisine parade, where colors, flavors and fragrance follow each other with something in common without ever been the same.
I love bringing friends there, just sharing and enjoying their emotion, every time a new dish comes on the table and seeing the fireworks in their eyes when the flavor delicately spread over their palate.
author: Cedrick C.

description: This is the only seven course beef place around S.F area so they jacked the prices so high.   The service is horrible.   I feel like those men always pushes you to order more and more food.  I only come here whenever I have that craving for 7 course beef.
author: LYNN K.

description: The wife and I recently tried the bo 7 mon (7 courses of beef) at Ahn Hong, and it was kinda meh... Started off on a high note with a nice salad and thin-sliced, boil it yourself beef course. Down-hill from there. 4 of the 7 courses are pretty similar sausage-type things. None were exactly bad but nothing made much of an impression. The soup that capped things off was alright but again, nothing special. You do get a lot of food, but the overall value is not that great ($18.95 per person at this location).  If you're after quantity more than quality the 7 course meal might be a good bet, but in my opinion there are much better ways to spend $18.95 on dinner in this neighborhood. (Hell, $18.95 will buy a lot of things in this neighborhood!)  The DIY aspect of wrapping everything in rice paper is kinda fun but the flavors of the different dishes all ran together. I might give Ahn Hong another try but I would skip the bo 7 mon and order a la carte. Maybe I would order a bo 7 mon or two to share with a large group, but I wouldn't order one again for myself...
author: Brian H.

description: The food was pretty good. But the parking definitely sucked big time. I think they should have valet parkers. The 7 course beef was yummy. Dennis the owner is the best!!!
author: jacqueline c.

description:
Great place. Traditional Vietnamese 7 course beef (many vietnamese places don't serve this or they do and charge you 30 per person). This place is only 17.50 per person. It's a great place to bring friends, co-workers, ect, They take reservations. 

Tip: the seven course portion is big, so for example if you dine one other person, you can just order the 7-course for 1, then some other dish or appetizer. If you dine with 2 other people, you can just order 2 portions and the three of ya share. If you bring a party of 10, you can just order 7 portions, that should be plenty for everyone. 

Don't over order because this type of food is not good a day after so leftovers are a waste of money.

And...the raw beef in lime juice is an awesome appetizer! It's like a beef ceviche. So good!!
author: Kim M.

description: need i say more. a world famous 7 course beef.  it was actually just okay for my tastebud (3 stars),  but the service of one waitress was supremely awesome (+ 1 star).
author: Bennet A.

description: thanks to shatangi and connie, i came here tonight for anh hong's famed 7 course beef, and what a feast it was!  though i can barely zip up my pants now, i must say that it was quite a treat.  service was slow at times, but the quality (and quantity) of food surpassed my expectations!  a must-come for anyone who loves beef!
author: Jill k.

description: The seven course beef is awesome. the place is semi-intimate. The service was ok.
author: John H.

description: There are about a bazillion double entendres about how much I love meat (wink, wink, nudge, nudge).  Go to Anh Hong for the multiple meat course and you too will be in on the fun.  I decided to take my future roommate Jason out for dinner since I have taken over a room in his current apartment without paying rent in lieu of having to go back to the shittiness that is my East Bay home.  He didn't care what we ate since he wasn't paying and I was feeling like Vietnamese but didn't know where to go.  Since the TL has always got whatever you're craving as long as you don't mind dodgy areas, I proposed walking till we found the first Vietnamese restaurant.  Anh Hong was it.  Jason and I both think that we could die happily now.  I feel like i stumbled upon the Holy Grail and I can't wait to look like an even bigger pimpstress than I already am by taking people here.  I will gloat as they enjoy the wonderful cuisine and great service and attempt to humbly brush aside their compliments to me for being a foodie but who are we kidding?!  I LOVE attention and I'm going to lap that shit UP!  Oh and the Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk is the stuff dreams are made of.  I am contemplating running a sweatshop just so I can have that good stuff daily.
author: Jill D.

description: Of course, you have to try the seven course beef, but no one has mentioned my  favorite dish....the grilled shrimp with sugar cane, the best.  This is the only place I go for Vietnamese, the best in the city for authenticity.  Try the shrimp next time and you will agree with me.  My dad introduced me to this place 18 years ago and my nine years old also loves their food, three generation!
author: Josephine T.

description: This is the best 7 course beef I have ever had. I've tried many other place with 7 course beef, but none of the others could beat this place. I have eaten at this restaurant since I was a little kid and the food still taste as great as ever. I totally recommend this place to anyone who loves meat. :)
author: Michael H.

description: Wow, 7 courses of beef------I felt like a cow afterwards!  It was so, so good. I loved all 7 courses and it was a good group experience =) I've been there a bunch of times and almost always order the same thing. 7 courses of beef and Anh Hong egg rolls (which are already in the 7 courses...but they are just too good!) This is the only time I come to the TL! haha But, it's worth it. They DO get packed, so get there early. 5:30-6 is the ideal time to go....plus, you have a to look for parking. =)
author: Michelle C.

description: I forgot to review Anh Hong - we went there a month or two ago, bunch of coworkers sharing the seven courses of beef. Funny thing, I don't eat beef. But it was all OK because we ordered a plate of chicken and I just wrapped stuff with chicken instead and it was delicious. (the main purpose of the seven courses of beef is wrapping a bunch of vegetables and meat, amongh other things, in rice paper that you prepare at your table). I also sampled the soup, which only has a tiny bit of beef in it anyway and easy to avoid (or they dished me up less beef on purpose - either way, I barely remember beef in that). And I'm glad I did sample the soup because it was amazing, possibly my favorite part of the meal. The vegetables were *great* - tons of them, and totally fresh. My friends have been there a bunch of times, and apparently there are other great things on the menu. One of those places I don't think you can go wrong at.
author: Jen D.

description: I came here with 4 friends for dinner, and we wanted only 2 orders of the 7 course beef. The waiter advised us to order more, but we told him we were not that hungry. Then the waiter went away for a couple of seconds and came back to tell us to order more. Again, we explained that we were not that hungry and we were fine with 2 orders of 7 course beef. My girlfriend came here before for 7 course beef and knows the portions. The waiter went away for a few minutes this time.  Then the waiter came back and insisted that we order more food. We left immediately.
author: Brad C.

description: My favorite Vietnamese restaurant in SF. It's a no frills, get you in-and-out kind of place in the Tenderloin, but it's clean and the food has never disappointed me. Beef salad, sugarcane shrimp, and unlimited fresh herbs and greens to accompany your order. Almost as good as my grandma's food.
author: Aileen T.

description: The service is horrible. Their food wasn't impressive. I came back after 10yrs because family gathering only. They refused to take two orders of 7-course beef because we were 6 of us and  three of us don't like beef.  So we I planned to order other food in the menu. They said we have to order at least 3 orders of 7-course beef otherwise they don't serve us!!!!!! We explained why we only want to order two of those because we want to order other dishes in the menue but they still insisted not to serve us if we don't order at least 3 orders of 7-course beef.  We swear we will not come back period. We were in disbelief and shock of how their disrespectful attitude- the tall waiter was so rude. We ask if we can have water because we didn't want any caffeine at night. He ignored us and never serve us water even when we ask the second time!!!! The food was bad and the price is over rated. I do not recommended to anyone if they want good service or good food.
author: Tai A.

description: Very authentic beef (in 7 different combo ways of serving)- needs to be skillful with 'the hands & fingers' - and please do try the 'brownish fish sauce' it does makes everything else taste even delicious! Good service overall- a great place to chill with friends- and they allow you to bring your own wine (not sure about corkage fee) Enjoy!!!!
author: Kaitlyn C.

description:
i always associated vietnamese cuisine as cheap ghetto and fast. but this probably has to be the best vietnamese restaurant experience i've ever had. mainly because it wasn't vietnamese sandwiches, 5 spiced chicken rice dishes and pho. 

7 preparations of beef

(1) beef salad - pretty good, not that much beef tho
(2) DIY spring roll type thingys (this is probably the best part of the meal
(3) sausage (this one is good, they bring it out with the meatballs) this one is kinda sweet ish, this one is my favorite sausage out of the three that came out
(4) meatballs - has noodles and stuff inside, pretty good too
(5) sausage wrapped in leaf - this one comes on a plate with two types of sausage, i like this one better than the other sausage but still not THAT fond of it. i think the general consensus is that the veggie filled sausage is not that good....
(6) veggie sausage thing. not that good tastes werid to me. and by this time i'm sick of sausage. get it out of my face. whats this weird thing coming out of my sausage? its too gingery or something....
(7) beef rice porridge thing - this is nice to have at at the end of the meal wash all that stuff down. nice and gentle on your stomach. not much beef in it, but its probably beef broth. 

my strong recommendations: if i were to do this again, (the group i went with was 13 people total, and we all eat pretty well) i would order 11 (12 is even stretching it) people's worth of that 7 types of beef dinner (last night we ordered 13 for 13), and then order extra plates of the shrimp sugar cane thing and the beef carpaccio type thing

the sausage just kills your enthusiasm for more food. so i recommend skimping a little on the 7 courses so that you can mix it up with a couple of side plates that will change it up a little so that everyone isn't exhausted of sausage at the end.

neighborhood wise, def recommend carpooling. don't be too threatened by the homeless people. just mind your own business and they will mind their own. one guy help us back out of our parking spot. how sweet of him........
author: Irene C.

description: so this is my second time eating 7 course beef meal and not every place have the same beef courses in the meal.  there are minor differences.  this place is not in the best neighborhood and parking can be a pain.  we ordered 2 of the 7 course beef meal for $17.95 each and the portion is bigger than Palogac.  service is not the best and the decor is not as nice as Palogac also.  still, i m still new to 7 course beef meal so i have more places to try.
author: Kapo T.

description:
as my friend said (and wrote on the receipt where the tip should've been) "BAD ATTITUDE, BAD SERVICE, BUT GOOD FOOD"

my friend decided she wanted to go here for dinner. being viet herself, she knows her viet food. this being her second visit here in one week, she knows the portions too! *i came one last year, so this is my second time, and now i remember why it took me a year to come back, i tend to block bad experiences from my memory LOL*

they sat at least 3 parties that came in behind us ahead of us, even though we kept reminding the host that we had called in and he kept telling us we were next. when we finally got a table we were promptly ignored for a good 10 minutes. no menu, no water, no tea, no hello, NOTHING! finally someone came to throw the menus at us, and my friend already knew she wanted the 7 courses of beef so she tried to order that first. for those of you who have had 7 courses, you know that's quite enough to fill two people. the waiter wouldn't let us order, he kept saying we have to order more! so my friend said "ok, just order the 7 courses for us first, we'll look through the menu and add some appetizers" he was not having it, he yelled "YOU ORDER MORE!" and said something rude in chinese and walked away! UM HELLO! I'M CHINESE I UNDERSTOOD WHAT YOU SAID ASSHOLE! AND DON'T MAKE COME IN THE KITCHEN AND CUSS YOU OUT IN CHINESE, ENGLISH, SPANISH AND VIETNAMESE!!!! but per my friend's request, i bit my tongue! we ended up ordering 2 orders of 7 courses since we were able to get her mom to join us who was right around the corner. halfway through the meal, the bowl of water for the rice wrappers had gotten cold so we asked for it to be refreshed as well as a refill on auntie's cup of hot water and our waters too! he came back with a refreshed bowl of hot water and that was it. we proceeded to wave someone down for the next 15 or 20 mins to get our water refilled. no luck. even though they was coming by to throw our food on the table, they acted like they didn't hear us about the water. FINALLY, she got someone's attention and asked him to refill CUP OF HOT WATER AND CUP OF COLD WATER! the waiter/owner came back with one hot water. so she asked again for her cold water. he let out a big sigh and came back with the called water and told her "you tell me to come here too many times! you asked for hot water and then cold water and what else you need now?" my friend calmly told him than "no, i asked for refills on the hot and the cold water the first time YOU DIDN'T HEAR ME!" then she told him in vietnamese that she's been asking for the water for 20 mins but everyone on staff had been ignoring our requests. 

auntie decided she wanted some porridge to go to, so we flagged someone down and got an order for her TO GO! the rude waiter/owner came with our bill and after reviewing it, my friend told him she ordered some porridge to go and it wasn't on the bill, so he took it back and fixed it. i thought that was nice of her cuz if it was me, after the service we got, i wouldn't have said shit! anyhow he came back the with the new bill and the porridge IN A BOWL!!! so my friend told him she ordered to go. he gave her dirty look WTF? she said "i told him it was TO GO!" asshole goes "you tole him you not tole me!" uh hello! shouldn't you and your staff be trained well enough to communicate with each other regarding customer orders! i shouldn't have to tell you how to do your job, you should already know how! should my friend have told everyone on the staff that she ordered porridge to go to make sure it was done right?! REALLYYY??!!!!!

my friend paid the bill, no tip, and she's a sweetheart and tips well, so for her to not leave a penny says a lot! and she made sure she wrote the above on the receipt too! we were just getting up to walk away when asshole came to pick up the bill. auntie said something to him in vietnamese. when we got outside i asked her what she had said to him, she said "i tell him thank you for nothing!" LOL

never coming back here, i don't expect asian restaurants to have good service, but i certainly don't expect to be treated that badly either! 7 courses great, but most of the courses are sausages anyway, so there's not that much variety and have to put it with that kind of service is not worth it! there are other places you can get 7 courses from that won't give you the stank eye!
author: Gaile C.

description:
thank you yelp! 
the 7 courses of beef was definitely a treat....
the sausages were amazing...as was the congee =) yum!

and entertainment while you eat ( we saw a guy that could bounce a quarter off the ground and catch it again.....okay it was more impressive to see it in person)

however, service was a little lacking at the end of the meal when they started to get a little busy. There was a big lag between our last two courses.
author: Joy Y.

description: Came here again recently.  Instead of doing the seven course beef we went a la carte instead.  This food was just as good as last time but I'm dropping a star because of the confusing service.  Last time we were a party of 2 guys and 2 girls and we were able to 3 orders of the seven course beef and it was very filling.  This time we were a party of 4 girls and 1 guy we since we figured we can order 4 items but the server made us order 5.  Probably would have helped if we spoke Vietnamese or if it was explained to us why we had to order five items.
author: Justin Y.

description: 7 course beef and sugarcane shrimp. They are good, but I like Pagolac better though the portion is bigger in Anh Hong. We tried 3 desserts but none of them were worth trying. Oh, also it was cold...
author: Charlie S.

description: This place is excellent.  I had their specialty, the seven courses of beef.  Each plate was delicious. The slices of beef were tender; the beef rolls were so moist and perfectly seasoned; beef wrapped in grape leaf was nicely grilled. The fish sauce was also perfect. There was so much food for one order.  At 17.95 a person, the meal was a real bargain.  Definitely recommended for large groups, vietnamese food lovers, and all true foodies.
author: Vivian T.

description:
tried the 7 course beef & in comparison to Pagolac, I would go back to Anh Hong instead. the portions are a bit more than Pagolac (but not by a whole lot--maybe and extra 2 pieces)....I dont know what other Yelpers were talking about in terms of getting "hella" food. 4 of us went, we ordered 3 orders of the beef course,  the sugar cane crab/shrimp meat appetizers &  vietnamese egg rolls. the total plus tip & tax was $96.00 for 3 orders of beef course & 2 appetizers. granted, we were pretty full but thats because we had 2 extra appetizers & cleaned it out. if we just ate the beef course..we prolly would've been just right.

as for the beef course, i have to question whether some of the the courses were in fact beef...esp. beef course # 1 "the beef salad"--no matter how you cook beef, the meat should come out looking grayish, NOT white!!! it tasted like pork or chicken or maybe even cat...hmm, is there an SPCA next door?
and the beef is essentially crap beef but im glad i tried it & got this whole "7 course beef thing" phenom out of my system...i wouldn't come back and eat this unless someone paid for my dinner. 

btw, service is abysmal & thank god i found parking less than half a block away. surprisingly, this place gets crowded....i have to question how ppl think it's soooo awesome--it ain't all that.
author: Yolanda L.

description: Anh Hong is the best Vietnamese restaurant ever! It's also unique in the way food is served. Most dishes requires you wrapping your own food in lettuce or rice paper. There are several dishes that stand out: the shrimp and pork salad, grilled shrimp with Banh Hoi,  and Chao Tom. The best of all are the fried spring rolls (Cha Gio). My family and I have been their customer for more than 10 years.
author: Hao K.

description: nice place-good food but too expensive-once in a while is OK.
author: Quan H.

description: came here for dinner to see what the fuss was about.. love their food...but they could tone down a bit on the MSG..had to drink 4 glass of water when eating their food..overall it was ok..!
author: Barry S.

description: My girlfriend (who is from Vietnam ) and I went to the Anh Hong restaurant, San Francisco for dinner.The waiter directed us to a table in a corner next to a stack of children's chairs. The waiter didn't smile and said almost nothing about what was going on.  We noticed that there were paper placemats on top of the tablecloth.  My girlfriend moved the placemat to adjust her napkin etc. and found large food particles which were stuck to the tablecloth along with stains which were being covered up by the placemats. The fish oil or whatever kind of stain it was had come up through the placemats. We should've left when we discovered that.  However, we had seen this restaurant promoted on "Check Please, Bay Area". We decided to give it a chance.  We ordered our food which included appetizer, soup and main course.  Our food was brought all at once.  Not only that, the waiter leaned over my girlfriend while she was eating to get children's chairs and didn't say, excuse me or anything.  In fact he didn't say anything at all.  As he was serving us I accidentally grazed my bowl of soup with my chopsticks as I was moving them out of the way for him. I spilled a little soup and he didn't offer to help cleanup the spill.  In fact, he made a noise as if he was annoyed and said nothing. He finished serving us and walked away.  As our food became cold from sitting on the table before we could eat it, we realized that the raw vegetables weren't fresh and the greens/herbs were out of proportion to what we were eating. Our drinks were not refilled and our waiter did not return at all during the meal to ask us if everything was OK or anything. I went to the restroom to watch the fish oil off my hands and it was filthy.  Logic told me that if the table cloths and the bathroom were dirty, the kitchen must also be. We finally had to go up to the counter to pay for our meal because the waiter did not bring our check.  This was a very disappointing dining experience.
author: Jay F.
